post-editing-item.post-editing: Auf die Frage Sawyers, wie sie sich fühle, antwortete Giffords, 41: "Ziemlich gut".

post-editing-item.source: The interview with Giffords and her husband, astronaut Mark Kelly, was part of an hour-long "20/20" special that aired on the eve of the release of the couple's new book, "Gabby: A Story of Courage and Hope."
post-editing-item.translation: Das Interview mit Giffords und ihrem Ehemann, Astronauten Mark Kelly, war Teil von ein Stunden-lang "20/20" besondere dass am Vorabend der Veröffentlichung "des" neuen Buches des Ehepaars, "Gabby" lüftete:Eine Geschichte von Mut und Hoffnung."
post-editing-item.post-editing: Das Interview mit Giffords und ihrem Ehemann, dem Astronauten Mark Kelly, war Teil eines einstündigen Specials von "20/20", das am Vorabend der Veröffentlichung des neuen Buches des Ehepaars "Gabby: Eine Geschichte von Mut und Hoffnung" ausgestrahlt wurde.

post-editing-item.source: The special traced Giffords's recovery since the Jan. 8 shooting.
post-editing-item.translation: Das besondere ging seit dem Jan. 8 Giffords' Erholung Schießerei nach.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Die Sondersendung beschrieb den Verlauf der Genesung Giffords seit der Schießerei am 8. Januar.

post-editing-item.source: In videos shot by Kelly in the first few weeks, she is seen in her hospital bed, her head shaved and a long scar across her forehead.
post-editing-item.translation: In Videos von Kelly erschossen in den ersten Wochen hat sie in ihrem Krankenhausbett angesehen wird, ihren Kopf rasierten und einer langen Wunde auf ihrer Stirn.
post-editing-item.post-editing: In Videos, die Kelly in den ersten Wochen aufnahm, ist sie in ihrem Krankenhausbett zu sehen, ihr Kopf ist rasiert und eine lange Wunde verläuft auf ihrer Stirn.

post-editing-item.source: She is capable only of holding up one or two fingers as her husband encourages her.
post-editing-item.translation: Sie ist nur fähig, ein oder zwei Finger hinauf halten, wie sie ihr Ehemann ermutigt.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Sie ist nur fähig, ein oder zwei Finger hochzuhalten, wenn ihr Ehemann sie dazu ermutigt.

post-editing-item.source: Months later, Giffords is seen sitting up in a wheelchair as therapists teach her how to perform simple actions.
post-editing-item.translation: Monate später angesehen wird Giffords oben sitzen im Rollstuhl sitzt als Therapeuten ihr beizubringen, wie man einfache Maßnahmen durchzuführen.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Monate später sieht man Giffords im Rollstuhl sitzen und Therapeuten bringen ihr bei, wie man einfache Aktionen durchführt.

post-editing-item.source: A nod of the head.
post-editing-item.translation: Ein Kopfnicken des Kopfes.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Ein Kopfnicken.

post-editing-item.source: A pucker of the lips.
post-editing-item.translation: Ein pucker der Lippen.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Ein Lippenverziehen.

post-editing-item.source: And then, her first word: "What."
post-editing-item.translation: Und dann, ihr erstes Wort: "Was".
post-editing-item.post-editing: Und dann, ihr erstes Wort: "Was".

post-editing-item.source: Within days, Giffords uttered another word - "toast," a request for a change in her breakfast menu.
post-editing-item.translation: Innerhalb weniger Tage Giffords geäußert, ein anderes Wort - "Toast auszusprechen", eine Forderung nach einer Änderung in ihrem Frühstück ,Speisekarte.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Innerhalb weniger Tage äußerte Giffords ein weiteres Wort - "Toast", eine Forderung nach einer Änderung ihres Frühstücks.

post-editing-item.source: Videos aired by ABC show that music played a central role in Giffords's recovery: The congresswoman is seen singing along with therapists to Cyndi Lauper's "Girls Just Wanna Have Fun" and Tom Petty's "Free Fallin." "
post-editing-item.translation: Videos von ABC zeigen, dass Musik spielte eine zentrale Rolle bei der Erholung: Die Congresswoman Giffords angesehen wird zusammen mit Therapeuten zu singen, Cyndi Lauper des "Girls Just Wanna Have fun" und Tom kleinlichen des "Free Fallin". "
post-editing-item.post-editing: Videos von ABC zeigen, dass Musik eine zentrale Rolle bei Giffords Genesung spielte: Die Kongressfrau ist zusammen mit Therapeuten zu sehen, wie sie Cyndi Laupers "Girls Just Wanna Have fun" und Tom Pettys "Free Fallin" singen.

post-editing-item.source: In the interview with Sawyer, Giffords, who goes through two hours of therapy every day, said she has no memory of the day of the shooting.
post-editing-item.translation: Im Interview mit Sawyer sagte Giffords, der durch zwei Stunden von Therapie jeden Tag geht, dass sie keine Erinnerung an den Tag der Schießerei hat.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Im Interview mit Sawyer sagte Giffords, die zwei Stunden Therapie pro Tag absolviert, dass sie keine Erinnerung an den Tag der Schießerei hat.

post-editing-item.source: Her husband said that he was reading Giffords a newspaper story about the shooting on March 12 when she stopped him to ask for the first time about the six who had been killed in the incident.
post-editing-item.translation: Ihr Ehemann sagte, dass er Giffords eine Zeitungsgeschichte über die Schießerei an dem März 12, als sie ihn stoppte, las, das erste Mal über das sechs zu benötigen, das im Zwischenfall getötet worden war.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Ihr Ehemann sagte, dass er Giffords am 12. März eine Zeitungsreportage über die Schießerei vorgelesen hatte, als sie ihn stoppte und das erste Mal nach den sechs Personen fragte, die beim Zwischenfall getötet worden waren.

post-editing-item.source: Suspected gunman Jared Lee Loughner is being held at a Missouri prison and is being forcibly medicated as he awaits trial.
post-editing-item.translation: In Verdacht gehabter Bewaffneter Jared Lee Loughner wird an einem Missouri-Gefängnis gehalten und wird gewaltsam medicated, wie er Prozess erwartet.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Der verdächtige Schütze Jared Lee Loughner ist in einem Gefängnis in Missouri inhaftiert und es werden ihm gewaltsam Medikamente verabreicht, während er seinen Prozess erwartet.

post-editing-item.source: "A lot of people died," Giffords told Sawyer.
post-editing-item.translation: "Eine Menge Menschen starben", erzählte Giffords Sawyer.
post-editing-item.post-editing: "Eine Menge Menschen starben", erzählte Giffords Sawyer.

post-editing-item.source: "Tough, tough, tough."
post-editing-item.translation: Das ist ziemlich hart!
post-editing-item.post-editing: "Das ist sehr hart!"

post-editing-item.source: At one point in his wife's recovery, Kelly told Sawyer, she said, "I've been beaten."
post-editing-item.translation: An einer Stelle in seinem Ehefrau Kelly Sawyer der Erholung, erzählte, sagte sie: "Ich geschlagen haben".
post-editing-item.post-editing: Zu einem Zeitpunkt während der Genesung seiner Frau, erzählte Kelly Sawyer, sagte sie: "Ich bin geschlagen worden."

post-editing-item.source: "So, I would say, "Gabby, you have not been beaten," " Kelly said.
post-editing-item.translation: "So würde ich sagen, "Gabby, sind Sie nicht geschlagen worden",?" Kelly sagte.
post-editing-item.post-editing: "Dann sagte ich, "Gabby, du bist nicht geschlagen worden," sagte Kelly.

post-editing-item.source: You've just been beat up.
post-editing-item.translation: Sie haben gerade zusammengeschlagen worden.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Du bist zusammengeschlagen worden.

post-editing-item.source: And you're going to get through this, and you're going to recover and you're going to come back stronger than ever.
post-editing-item.translation: Und Sie werden dadurch gelangen, und Sie werden sich erholen und Sie werden zurückkommen stärker als jemals.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Und du wirst es überstehen, und du wirst dich erholen und du wirst stärker als jemals zurückkommen.

post-editing-item.source: Troops feel more pity than respect
post-editing-item.translation: Truppen fühlen mehr Mitleid als Achtung
post-editing-item.post-editing: Truppen fühlen mehr Mitleid als Respekt

post-editing-item.source: The event was a Wall Street gala that raised millions of dollars for homeless veterans in New York City.
post-editing-item.translation: Das Ereignis war eine Wall-Street-Galaveranstaltung, die Millionen von Dollars für obdachlose Veteranen in New-York-Stadt hochhob.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Das Ereignis war eine Wall-Street-Galaveranstaltung, die Millionen von Dollars für obdachlose Veteranen in New-York-City einbrachte.

post-editing-item.source: Kid Rock sang a ballad about helplessness, frustration and loss.
post-editing-item.translation: Kinder-Felsen sang eine Ballade über Hilflosigkeit, Frustration und Verlust.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Kid Rock sang eine Ballade über Hilflosigkeit, Frustration und Verlust.

post-editing-item.source: On cue, several hundred soldiers, sailors, airmen and Marines strode into position around him.
post-editing-item.translation: Genau auf's Stichwort schritten einige einhundert Soldaten, Matrosen, Flieger und Marine in Position um ihn.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Genau auf's Stichwort schritten einige hundert Soldaten, Matrosen, Flieger und Marines in Position um ihn herum.

post-editing-item.source: The black-tie crowd rose to its feet and cheered.
post-editing-item.translation: Die schwarz-Krawatte Menge stieg auf die Beine zu helfen und jubelte.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Die in Abendgarderobe gekleidete Menge stand auf und jubelte.

post-editing-item.source: "The servicemen and women were regarded as heroes," said David Saltzman, who organized the spring fundraiser.
post-editing-item.translation: "Die Soldaten und Frauen als Helden angesehen wurden", sagte David Saltzman, die organisierte die Frühjahr Wahl Spender treffen vertreten.
post-editing-item.post-editing: "Die Soldaten und Soldatinnen wurden als Helden angesehen", sagte David Saltzman, der dieses Frühjahres-Fund-Raising-Event organisierte.

post-editing-item.source: A senior military officer at the gala, also attended by the Joint Chiefs then-chairman, Adm. Mike Mullen, saw the troops" role differently.
post-editing-item.translation: Ein älterer militärischer Offizier an der Galaveranstaltung, auch vom Gelenk-Häupter-Dannvorsitzenden, Adm besucht. Mikrofon Mullen, sah die Truppen" Rolle anders.
post-editing-item.post-editing: Ein hochrangiger militärischer Offizier auf der Galaveranstaltung, die auch vom damaligen Vorsitzenden der Joint Chiefs, Adm. Mike Mullen, sah die Rolle der Truppen anders.

post-editing-item.source: "They were rolled out like some sort of orphan kid," the officer wrote in an e-mail.
post-editing-item.translation: "Sie wurden wie einige irgendwie-Waise-Kinder ausgerollt", der Offizier schrieb eine E-Mail hinein.
post-editing-item.post-editing: "Sie wurden irgendwie wie Waisenkinder vorgeführt", schrieb der Offizier in eine E-Mail hinein.

post-editing-item.source: Parliament Does Not Support Amendment Freeing Tymoshenko
Today, the Ukraine parliament dismissed, within the Code of Criminal Procedure amendment, the motion to revoke an article based on which the opposition leader, Yulia Tymoshenko, was sentenced.
The amendment that would lead to freeing the imprisoned former Prime Minister was revoked during second reading of the proposal for mitigation of sentences for economic offences.
In October, Tymoshenko was sentenced to seven years in prison for entering into what was reported to be a disadvantageous gas deal with Russia.
The verdict is not yet final; the court will hear Tymoshenko's appeal in December.
Tymoshenko claims the verdict is a political revenge of the regime; in the West, the trial has also evoked suspicion of being biased.
The proposal to remove Article 365 from the Code of Criminal Procedure, upon which the former Prime Minister was sentenced, was supported by 147 members of parliament.
Its ratification would require 226 votes.
Libya's Victory
The story of Libya's liberation, or rebellion, already has its defeated.
Muammar Kaddafi is buried at an unknown place in the desert. Without him, the war is over.
It is time to define the winners.
As a rule, Islamists win in the country; the question is whether they are the moderate or the radical ones.
The transitional cabinet declared itself a follower of the customary Sharia law, of which we have already heard.
Libya will become a crime free country, as the punishment for stealing is having one's hand amputated.
Women can forget about emancipation; potential religious renegades will be executed; etc.
Instead of a dictator, a society consisting of competing tribes will be united by Koran.
Libya will be in an order we cannot imagine and surely would not ask for.
However, our lifestyle is neither unique nor the best one and would not, most probably, be suitable for, for example, the people of Libya.
In fact, it is a wonder that the Islamic fighters accepted help from the nonbelievers.
Their only excuse is that from their point of view, NATO raids were not controlled by an American general, but Allah, the greatness of whom they celebrated with each strike.
When winners are sought for in Libya, the West is not on the list.
We participated in a shooting, served Islam, and our politicians got rid of a dictator, their political ally, without any guarantee of profit.
Given the recent bad experience from Afghanistan and Iraq, we decided against military occupation of Libya.
The locals thus do not have to worry about expelling of the "crusaders."
Without the occupation, will the oil companies get Libya's black gold for next to nothing, though?
It is quite likely that they will not. The West will then finally be able to boast about its selfless protection of human rights.
Unless the followers of the Sharia law put a stop to that.
New Era of Crisis Commences
France and the rest of Europe are now in the investors" spotlight.
A statistical storm blew over Europe on Tuesday.
Individual countries released their 3Q GDP data.
Between quarters, the Czech economy stagnated; Germany and France are growing.
Yet the debit market is breaking records today.
Investors are no longer looking at only Italy; they now focus on Spain, France, Austria, and others.
Eurozone statistical offices in Germany, Czech Republic, and some other countries, released their preliminary estimates of economic development in the third quarter.
Germany's GDP has grown by the expected 0.5%; and France's by 0.4%.

Both countries also adjusted their second quarter data, where Germany did better than expected (a 0.3% increase instead of the original 0.1%). France reported a slight decrease, by 0.1% (the original information suggested stagnation).
In this year's third quarter, the Czech economy showed an interim increase of 1.5%.
Between the quarters though, the GDP stagnated. According to the Czech Statistical Office, this confirmed the trend of a gradual slowing of economic growth.
The results are worse than estimates by analysts.
Key events:
In this year's third quarter, Czech economy showed an interim increase of 1.5%; however, it stagnated between the quarters.
Based on preliminary and seasonal data, in the third quarter, the German economy grew by 0.5%.
Between July and September, the economy of both the Eurozone and the European Union grew, compared to the previous quarter, by 0.2%, which corresponds with estimates by analysts.
The Greek economy showed an interim decrease of 5.2%.
The earnings on its 10-year bonds are 28.45%.
Earnings of both Italian and Spanish bonds are growing towards critical limits.
Even Austria, Netherlands, France, and Belgium, etc. are beginning to experience problems.
Despite the fact that the situation in the region is getting worse, earnings of Czech 1 - year bonds stay under 4%.
Voices are coming from Germany, suggesting that ECB be the last resort creditor.
Czechs qualified for EURO.
In Montenegro they won 1:0 and celebrate a 200 million windfall.
Football representation successfully managed the toughest task of the season!
Thanks to both the great Čech and beautiful goal of Petr Jiráček ,they won 1:0.
In the second half, Czech football was lucky to maintain its luxury lead from the home return match, and will again feature at the European Championship.
IHNED.cz watched the progress match in a detailed report.
Nearly no excitement in the first half, and a great portion of luck in the other.
Czech representation team, partially due to the home team's failure in the close; the great Čech; and heroic Jiráček; won 1:0 in Montenegro, and celebrates moving on to the European Championship.
Perfect Czech team defence only allowed the Montenegro team to threaten in the second half.
Damjanovic and Vucinic became the match's least lucky couple after losing two great opportunities.
The wonderful Petr Čech is one of the reasons the Czech representation team will not miss the next year's European Championship. And Czech football will thus gain nearly 200 million Czech Crowns.
From the opening minutes, the game was very pugnacious.
Both teams found it difficult to join in the combination; the game remained around the mid-field line most of the time.
That was also why there was no pressure from the home team in the first half. Long kicks behind the defence were neatly averted by the Czech defence.
Iranian Students Are Prepared to Die for Their Country's Nuclear Program
They created a live shield.
Several hundred university students created a live chain around the nuclear power plant in Iran.
The gesture is to express their support of their country's nuclear program against a possible Israel attack.
At Tuesday noon, students' prayers in front of the building were followed by their chanting of death to both the USA and Israel.
In Isfahan, Iran, several hundred university students created a live chain around Isfahan Uranium Conversion Facility.
This way, they express their readiness to protect their country's nuclear program with their own lives.
In its recent report, the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) stated that everything leads to the conclusion that Iran has not stopped striving for a nuclear weapon.
Possible attack on Iran nuclear facilities has been discussed in Israel.
At Tuesday noon, students' prayers in front of the entrance into Isfahan Uranium Conversion Facility were followed by their chanting of death to both the USA and Israel.

In case of an attack, aimed at the highest possible paralysation of the Iranian nuclear program, the targets would be, based on Israel press, the facilities in both Isfahan and Natanz, where the uranium is being enriched.
An Obese Child's Diet: No breakfast and sausage for dinner
Over a third of children between 9 and 13 are overweight; while 9% of schoolchildren are overweight, 5% are obese.
As a recent research shows, obese children usually come from families with unhealthy lifestyle.
Again, we can see the importance of the environment and models surrounding a human being for his or her healthy development.
For example, sausages occur up to half more frequently on the tables of obese children compared to the families of children with standard weight.
Over 19% of obese children had fried chips for dinner the day before the research connected to the educational event called Obesity is No Accident.

Moreover, the families of obese children do not practise sports. However, this concerns a majority of families of current schoolchildren - only 15% of the children said their parents find time for sports activities at least once a week.
The research was performed among 900 children.
The research took place at the end of last year's school year; it included almost 900 elementary school children from throughout Bohemia.
It was the second year of the Obesity is No Accident event supported by both Všeobecná zdravotní pojišťovna insurance company and Unilever.
So far, the project has been joined by over 12 thousand school children from 4th to 8th grades.
Proper diet and sufficient sports activities represent key defining factors causing dramatically growing number of children who are either overweight or obese.

"For example, only half of those inquired said they have five meals a day, in the breakfast-snack-lunch-snack-dinner pattern, one of the basic preconditions of correct diet," one of the results of the research says.
No lunch and sausage in the evening
Experts warn that even relative details are crucial for healthy development; such as a regular time of family breakfast.
In the Czech Republic, only 23% of schoolchildren's families have breakfast together.
In a majority of families, everyone has breakfast separately.
The worst discovery was the fact that in one tenth of households people do not have breakfast at all.
Yet breakfast is the core of proper daily diet.
A survey has shown that fries are consumed more often in the families of obese children.
Nearly everyone - regardless of their weight - drinks sweet soft drinks every day (70%).
Though over 40% of children do sports regularly, the number drops down to less than a half - 15% - when it comes to their parents.
Compose your own menu
Another part of the survey allowed selected children (204 boys and 172 girls from 13 schools) to compose their own menu based on selection offered and their taste and opinions.
